text.autoconfig.bodar.title: BoDaR Config Menu
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.isOn.@Toolt: If the mod is active or not
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.invisibleWo: If we render the world or not
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.multiplayer: If off, it wont send any packets to the server
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.size.@Toolt: How big the area is of the BoDaR beam
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.density.@To: How dense the beams are (more dense = more particles = less performance
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.reach.@Tool: How far the dot will reach (higher = less performance)
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.randomRotat: If the dot are randomly rotated or not
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.doubleSided: If particles are double sided (may increase performance)
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.maxAge.@Too: Maximum age of of the particles (In Sec)
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.fadeOutTime: Time it takes for particles to fade out after being broken (In Sec)
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.skyboxColor: What color to show when not rendering the world.
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.renderEntit: If particles show up on entities or not
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.particleCol: Choose how particle colors are determined
Mixed: Uses predefined colors when available, otherwise uses world colors
World: Always uses colors based on the block's map color
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.oreColor.@T: Color of particles when the hit a ore
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.functionalC: Color of particles when they hit a functional blocks (eg. furnace)
text.autoconfig.bodar.option.functionals: What block is considered a "Functional Block"
